meanings.sent1: The store had a variety of merch on display.
meanings.sent2: She bought some cool merch at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the merch display in the store.
meanings.sent4: His room was filled with so much merch, it looked like a mini store.
meanings.sent5: The online shop offered unique and trendy merch for customers.

meanings.sent1: They decided to merch their new product through social media.
meanings.sent2: The company used influencers to merch their latest collection.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to merch his magic tricks to the audience.
meanings.sent4: She was able to merch her artwork successfully at the art fair.
meanings.sent5: The band hired a marketing team to merch their upcoming album.

meanings.definition: The act of buying and selling goods or commodities
meanings.sent1: The market was bustling with merch activity.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed the thrill of participating in merch transactions.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show turned into a merch frenzy after the performance.
meanings.sent4: She found a passion for the world of merch after starting her own business.
meanings.sent5: The history of merch dates back to ancient times when bartering was common.
